Elliotte Harold wrote:
> JSON is a clever kludge designed to work within the limitations of
> JavaScript 1.0 and browser APIs. However if E4X had been reliably
> available across browsers it would never have been necessary, and
> probably wouldn't have been invented.

Well, in fact, JSON is really just JavaScript literal syntax, co-opted 
for wider usage.  I've never been a fan of JSON because you can 
(unsafely) eval() it in your JS code.  I've been a fan of it because it 
makes it easy to express arrays, maps, and other data-y things in a tidy 
fashion.

--
